summary: A brief email or text message sent on August 10, 2019, referencing an incident in New York and encouraging someone to send a message to an unnamed busy individual. The document appears to be a forwarded or saved communication.

events.title: Incident in New York
events.description: An unspecified incident occurred in New York, prompting the sender to reassure the recipient that 'All is as good as can be' and to suggest sending a message to a third party.

keyFacts: The communication is dated August 10, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in a New York jail.
The message references an 'incident at New York today,' which strongly correlates with the news of Epstein's death.
The tone is reassuring ('All is as good as can be') and suggests sending support to an unnamed, busy individual.
The document is a forwarded or saved message from a mobile device, indicating it was part of a larger chain of communications.
